email_content:
Hi Sarah,

I hope you’re doing well!

I wanted to share a brief update on what our team has been working on lately and invite Helping Hands to collaborate with us for our upcoming community charity event.

Recent Activities
• Volunteer engagement – our parish volunteers have been running weekend food-drive collections and tutoring sessions for neighborhood children.
• Resource coordination – we’ve gathered and distributed more than 200 care packages that include non-perishable foods and school supplies for local families.
• Event planning – we’ve finalized the date and initial framework for this year’s charity day and begun coordinating roles with volunteers and partners.

Upcoming Charity Event – Saturday, March 15
• Theme: “Neighbors Helping Neighbors,” a full day of service projects (park clean-ups, senior-center visits, free health screenings) capped by an evening community dinner.
• Location: St. Mark’s Community Hall and the surrounding neighborhood.
• Volunteer needs: registration desk support, activity leads, medical professionals for screenings, and drivers for donation pick-ups.
• Transparency & reporting: all funds and in-kind donations will be logged and publicly reported to ensure complete accountability.

How Helping Hands Can Get Involved
1. Co-host a service station (e.g., a health-screening booth or children’s activity area).
2. Share volunteer sign-up information with your network.
3. Provide educational materials on sustainable community service.

If you and your team are interested, just let me know—I'd be happy to send over the detailed run-of-show and schedule a quick call next week to coordinate.

Thank you for the incredible work Helping Hands continues to do. We appreciate your partnership and look forward to the possibility of working together again.

Warm regards,

[Your Name]
[Your Role / Organization]
[Contact Info]
